title: Hollywood North: Fox ramps up the hype for Vancouver-filmed X-Files revival
text:
By Scott Brown, Vancouver Sun Shooting of X-Files in Vancouver, starring David Duchovny and Gillian Anderson. Photograph by: Francis Georgian , PNG While we have to wait a few more months before finding out if revival series is a hit or a miss, Fox continues to smash it out of the park in terms of promotional hype for the sci-fi reboot. ** MOBILE USERS click HERE for video. The six-episode “event series” will hit the small screen in January. Carter, the show’s creator, screened the first episode of X-Files Season 10 last week at , three months ahead of its Jan. 24 premiere on Fox. The new series will expand on the X-Files’ UFO mythology but will also include some standalone episodes. Which hopefully means we can look forward to some “monsters of the week” episodes as well the show’s overall aliens-are-among-us narrative. Original stars David Duchovny , and Carter shot the new X-Files this summer in Vancouver and around B.C. The series was shot here for the first five seasons of its original nine-year run (1993-2002). This time around, thanks to social media, fans were treated to sneak peeks SHOOTING IN VANCOUVER … • Hollywood heavyweight producer Jerry Bruckheimer (CSI, Top Gun) has chosen Vancouver as the filming location for a couple of his television projects. We have told you about Lucifer , his Satan in Los Angeles series that Fox is shooting here, but production has also openly locally on Home , a TNT pilot that delves into the secrets lingering behind the facade of a seemingly idyllic suburban family. Andrew Buchan (Broadchurch) plays a highly regarded prison psychologist with a shady past, while Bethany Joy Lenz (One Tree Hill) stars as the wife discovering his secrets. The supporting cast includes Bruce Greenwood (Star Trek, Mad Men) and JoBeth Williams (Poltergeist, The Big Chill). (The Machinist, Fringe) directs. **MOBILE USERS click for video. • Lookinglass , an hour-long science fiction thriller from Fox, continues to shoot in Vancouver ahead of its 2016 premiere as a midseason series. The show, originally titled The Frankenstein Code, centres on Ray Pritchard, a 75-year-old corrupt cop who dies and is then reanimated into the body of a much younger man. Philip Baker Hall (Boogie Nights) plays old Pritchard, while (True Blood, Pacific Rim) stars as new Pritchard. • Actor/comedian Rob Riggle (21 Jump Street, Modern Family) will get serious in Midnight Sun , a feature film which began production this week in Vancouver. Midnight Sun stars Bella Thorne as a young woman with a disease that makes even the slightest bit of sunlight potentially lethal to her. , son of Arnie, also stars.
